content.detailedDescription:
I was in the living room and my mother yelled for me to "come here!". she was looking out her bedroom window, and asked me "what is that?!?" i saw what looked like a squat pyramid shape, and thought it might just be a balloon, but then i saw it slowly moving and realized it was quite large. my next thought was maybe a blimp, but this was very strangely shaped for a blimp. i was in shock and just watched it for a bit, then yelled for my brother to come see and show the rest of the family. we noticed some red lights on the bottom, slowly flashing on and off. i ran to the balcony and continued to watch it for about 30 seconds before running to find my sisters camera and record video of it. i then proceeded to record video from the balcony and later from the parking lot outside. the object very slowly drifted from west to east while gaining altitude, very much like what i imagine a large balloon would do. we noticed some slow clockwise rotation that didn't seem consistent.

we were watching the object with binoculars, as well as trying to get video.
the object eventually climbed up near the cloud layer and we lost sight of it behind the apartment building.

i was very excited as i had always hoped to see a ufo, but also disappointed as i have a feeling this was probably just a 4th of july prank.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Pyramid shaped, slow-floating, dark, apparently solid object with 6+ flashing lights on the bottom

content.detailedDescription:
1. my neighbor and i were sitting outside watching fireworks.  

2. i was watching the sky in addition to watching the fireworks.
at 10pm we saw a steady round glow, which appeared to be yellowish in the center and surrounded by a red or orangish glow, larger than a star, steadily moving across the sky from east to southwest, to the south of us.  then we lost sight of it, as it got further away, whether it was too high up or too far west, we don't know.  

3. it was odd, definitely did not have two or more lights which appear on planes.  at first we just thought maybe we couldn't see the other lights, because of the angle and that maybe it was just a small 2 passenger plane and that it was too far off to see good.  we were fascinated with the sighting and discussing it, wondering what it might be.

4. at a distance, it appeared round and was continuously lit the whole time it was in view. we continued watching the fireworks, then almost exactly 15 minutes later, @ 10:15pm, another object identical to the first, appeared, traveling from the east (it appeared to come from the same exact direction as the first) traveling to the west, this time not as far to the south of us as the first object. once again, it disappeared as it got further away.  then fifteen minutes later (10:30pm),  another identical object appeared, this time going right over us.   then two more objects appeared one at a time within the next 5 minutes, each one traveling further to the northwest of us than the last.  10:30pm was the last sighting.  we continued watching until about 11:10pm and did not see any other objects.  on each occasion, the one preceding it would disappear before the next one would appear.  

5. we were calm and curious.  i mentioned the possibility of weather balloons, then ufos because they seemed to be traveling with a purpose in mind.  she was wondering at first if it was a search party for something, because they were all 5 traveling at different angles.

6. we lost sight of the objects because of distance.
content.summary: 5 glowing objects, yellowish glow in center surrounded by reddish or orangish color, individually traveling east to west

content.detailedDescription: We were in the pool after watching fireworks, as we looked up to the sky we seen an orange ball of light flying southwest. about a minute and a half later it started fading out. in about a course of ten minutes, we seen four sites of the same ball of light go in the same direction but in a different place. later that night at about eleven thirty, we went back outside and saw another ball of light flying southwest again. after that, we seen it again. it flew southwest for about thirty seconds, disappeared. then re-appeared in the same place it appeared before in about a quarter of a second. we have nine people that witnessed this.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: O-balls

content.detailedDescription:
Watching santee lakes fireworks from balcony. reached for my drink, and noticed steady red light hovering to the east. at first i thought it was fireworks, but noticed it was not on an ascending or descending trajectory. oblect seemed to be motionless at first, then noticed it slowly moving wsw, coming closer to my location extremely slow. grabbed binoculars and seen that it was a steady red light, pulsating slightly. when viewed with naked eye, it seemed to pulsate every so often. my fiance got my camera and i took a few pictures. the objest was not an aircraft- i am retired military, and i know what aircraft navigation lights look like. the object did not strobe, it was a bright, steady red, seeming to pulse about every minute or so. it was also too stationary to have been either a fixed or rotary wing aircraft. as we were watching, it suddenly just blinked out or disappeared. may have been a balloon with a bright red light on it, but the light appeared pretty good size, so i doubt it was a balloon, unless it was a very good sized balloon. as far as i know, balloons have to have a strobe type nav light attached, and this was not strobing.
also, as i was trying to take a picture, my fiance said "look, another one". as i turned, i seen a steady red light, very low, disappear behind the trees to the north,, northeast almost like it was on approach to gillespie field. neither object seemed to emit any type of noise associated with either regular aircraft or jet propulsion.
 i will send pictures after i download them.
content.summary: Steady red light, moving slowly

content.detailedDescription: At approximatelt 10:30 pm, i observed a star like object moving from a sw to ne direction i first thought it was a satilited until it  it suddenly disappeared. at 1am i went back outside and saw another star like object traveling in almost the exact oppostie direction and i watch it until it also disappeared.
content.summary: I observed a star like object moving from a sw to ne direction

content.detailedDescription: Many-over ten, balloons were released around the area of wyoming valley,-w-b, pa. i saw a few w/ the american flag around them, a few red, orange, & white ones. they rose sometimes around 1000 ft. & went out. witnessed them white, & dark, after burnout. they travel w/ the wind. most went straight up w/ a wobble, or went slow across sky. [& are not to be confused w/ the ufo's witnessed by me, & others on 4th 2009]not ufo"s! & pose a danger to aircraft!
content.summary: Balloon realeases

content.detailedDescription: I was watching the fireworks from my backyard, looking north i could see a red beacon light, then just above it and a little to the east there appeared to be an orange ball of light, i looked though the binoculars and it didn't look any different, it traveled south for a while then veered to the south west and disappeared. a few minutes later i saw another one that traveled the same path. they were in no hurry then they just disappeared.
content.summary: Possible obals

content.detailedDescription: We saw the same thing in oakforest, il. tonight too.(7-4-11) right before the fireworks show. they all appeared from nowhere then flew directly over us starting from very far away coming towards us. all started out as a red ball of light. sometimes flickering, usually solid. some faded before they got to us, but most just stayed red. all flying very slow, & did not make any noise. the last one, the red light faded just as it flew above us and i clearly saw that it was a white disk because the jewel parking lot light by us reflected up to the bottom of it. .No doubt in my mind it was not a plane or helicopter.That makes it a ufo to me. i only had the camera on my phone and the pictures came out too dark to see anything. not worth uploading to the sight but i feel the need to tell someone about it. i see a few youtube videos from tongiht with the same thing. my view was much better than these videos, but it seems people are seeing this in kentucky, indiana, and illinois tonight from what i saw uploaded to you tube. i am a believer after tonight.
content.summary: Red sphere, turns to white disk. oak forest,il. 7-4-11 @ 9pm just before fireworks show.

content.detailedDescription:
I just wrote a detailed description but when i tried to submit it an error occurred and it's now gone. i'm too frustrated now to re type it. so i will be very brief.  i was in front of my building watching my neighbors fireworks, they had some awesome pyro so i kept my eye on the sky.   

it looked like a firework but it was flying over head on a northern course. it was a firey flame, yellow to orange in color. it traveled straight at air craft speed and was silent 500"-25,000" altitude. later a similar light appeared  above the tree line to the north... i went in side for an optic and went i got back outside  it was gone.  i saw it again at around the same spot.  appearing stationary it flickered and phased in and out until it disappeared.  

i was googling and found out this type of sighting was common on this holiday.  i went back out side and saw another stationary light above the tree line this time to the north east.  it was brighter and appeared to be closer, it too began to phase in and out until it vanished.
content.summary: Fireball flying silently, then appeared stationary phasing in and out over the horizon.

content.detailedDescription: We were firing fireworks then i (oldest bother) and my sister, little brother, mother looked into the sky we saw a green orb (bright as car headlights in a distance) flying 2x faster then a plane. we looked around the sky and saw multiple airlines flying with blinking lights across the sky, while this event was happening and there was a noticeable difference between to two. this green orb flew across the sky southbound until it was gone. again the green orb flew straight 2x the speed of a plane at airline altitude. we brought out binoculars to get a detailed look, i noticed it was a oval shaped with green in the middle surrounded with a red/orange light. without binoculars it was the size of a pin point. the object wasn't directly over us but was 45 degrees off the horizon. very strange...
content.summary: Green orb fly across southwestern sky

content.detailedDescription: We were watching the fire works but you can see that the flashing stops and there is still something red flying thru the air and it does not burn out it is not part of the upper fire works displays.First one came thru the sky at about 9:00pm it was red and no blinking lights and did not follow the normal plane patterns and did not make noise. the second one came like a half hour later i showed my husband and we followed it thru the skies for a while until it disappeared and then a third one came thru like twenty minutes later or so.We could not figure out what the objects were. then like an hour later there were two fly almost side by side. i called a neighbor to witness this and he said they were watching it from their back yard. when we were watching them it lasted for like five minutes maybe a little longer and then they just vanished into the sky. the neighbor, my husband and i all seen them.
content.summary: Red in color and no blinking lights

content.detailedDescription: Fourth of july fireworks are winding down in the community--we live in town. i was outside letting the dog have a pee before bed and still heard the occasional pop or crackle...Then a ring of orange lights passed over the top of my neighbors house across the street and came over my house--ithought it was some piece of a firework or a chinese lantern or something. it was wierd the way it flew so quickly. i watched to see if it would flicker and burn out or if it would start to arc toward the earth---it just kept a steady cruising speed until it went out of sight over the houses behind us. no noise--i didnt have my glasses on so i couldnt tell if the ring of lights were surrounding a craft or if the thing was just an energy deal like the orbs are. i do know that it was wierd that the thing was cruising so steadily and there was really no breeze to speak of. i looked on the weather channel and the breeze is 6 km per hour south west. this thing was going straight east. i just said--oh...There's one! i have waited since i was 15 to see another ufo...The first one i saw was similar in that it cruised so deliberately. that was in california a lifetime ago lol!!  i hope someone else saw what i saw tonight and writes in--let me know ok?
content.summary: Orange in color looked like it was made up of 5 or 6 lites in a circle like maybe a chinese lantern but it was going against the breeze--it was low -about 200 feet over the houses and cruised on by.

content.detailedDescription: 2 years ago exactly on july 4th and 5th, i was on my front porch looking southeast and this red light appeared coming over the mountains over our light towers. this is directly in the flight path of the wilkes-barre/scranton international airport. so i've seen thousands of planes, helicopters, etc and i've never seen anything like this. then a couple weeks ago, i was on my back deck and at first i thought it was a plane far away coming in for a landing but as i watched it this red light it moved left, then stayed stationary for a few seconds then went straight up, the moved away from me westward and disappeared. a few minutes later i was putting out my cigarette butt and looked up and their is 2 red balls of light. they were stationary for a moment. then they went away from one another, then back towards one another, then the red ball on the right went quickly to the right, which would be north  while the other stayed stationary, then it moved up rapidly, then to the left back towards the other red light then it went west and disappeared. then the other red light that was still stationary, went diagonally upwards and disappeared. then tonight, july 4 2011, i was outside about 9:30 waiting for our local fireworks display towards the west of my house and i was looking east toward our mountain and this red light starts coming from the east, then stops for a few moments then goes back towards the east. this happened 5 times in the next 2 1/2 hours. when i saw it again, i went and got my neighbor next door, who just got home and she said she and her friend saw it before too. now i'm outside, this time with my binoculars and this was coming from the southeast over our local radio/tv light towers and with the binoculars i could see 5 red lights underneath and it looked triangular in shape and it took a big arcing turn towards the east and disappeared. 2years ago, the same kind of object took a 45 degree turn and disappeared. not moving fast but just one second it was there and the next it was gone. i'm always looking up in the sky and we did have fireworks all over tonight but they're all done now and i saw it again. i'm looking for these red balls of lights now. with the naked eye you just see a red light, but tonight you could see more than one and they were not blinking like all aircraft do. i just know they are not any aircraft i have ever seen before.
content.summary: 2 weeks ago 2 red balls seen west of wilkes-barre, tonight 5 separate sightings

content.detailedDescription: As before, i was sitting on my back porch, thinking about about the incedent a few hrs. earlier, when again the object appeared in the same general direction. i jumped up reached inside the door and grabbed my binoculars and camera that i left on the kitchen counter. i looked throughthe binoculars first and saw no flashing white lights and/ or green and red lights. i got the camera took 3 pictures and a movie of the object. on the first picture i had the flash on and got the stars in the background. the 2 & 3 picture no flash, nothing. on the movie i got the same, nothing.. i was watching the object over the camera during the pictures and movie. approx. 10 sec. after the movie, the object disapeared.
content.summary: Same object i seen before

content.detailedDescription: We were setting off fireworks and they were going off all around us in the neighborhood so we were looking in all directions.  one of us noticed a light in the sky that appeared larger than a star (3-4 times larger in diameter than an average star).  it was circular in shape and was the orangish color of a street lamp.  the light it emitted seemed to emanate from the object in an orangish hazy glow.  while we were looking at it we initially thought it was an airplane, but there were no flashing lights on it and it's movement was not that of a plane. it looked to be heading towards us and then suddenly moved left and then right, left and then right.  while it was doing this it was moving side to side in a way that i've never seen any aircratft do.  it appeared to float.  after it stopped moving from side to side, it continued moving towards us, slightly to the right.  once we pulled out our camera to video it, it slowly (about 10 seconds) dimmed out.  it is without a doubt the weirdest i have ever seen.  we all contemplated airplanes, fireworks, burning ambers from fireworks but there is no way it could have been that.  for one, it was too high in the sky to be fireworks or firework debris (not to mention it didn't move like a firework or debris.) and number two, it certainly didn't move like a plane. whatever we saw was certainly unidentifiable.  there were plenty of other planes in the sky tonight, none looked or moved like this object and all of them had their flashing navigation lights which were easily visible.
content.summary: Hazy orange circular floating light

content.detailedDescription:
We were walking home after viewing the fireworks and i saw what initially looked like a city street light - about the same orange-yellow color.  i pointed it out to my family and we all stood and watched it move slowly from south to north (we were facing west). it was moving horizontally, neither ascending or descending, and we could not hear any noise from it.

after about 2 minutes it paused for about 30 seconds, and then it appeared to be moving to the west and eventually flew out of sight.

our best description of the 'object' is that it was glowing with a sort of a fuzzy halo around it.  there appeared to be 4 spiky legs protruding from the bottom.
content.summary: Orange-ish object floating/hovering moving slowly s to n then veered to the west and out of sight

content.detailedDescription: Before the 4th of july fireworks started, my family and i noticed a big red glowing orb, coming from north to south over bloominging indiana. it appeared to travel at an altitude of about 1 mile high. there were no blinking lights at any view point of its travel. it traveled in a straight line and was observed by hundreds of people looking to watch the fireworks show. look for other sightings directly north and south of location. indianapolis, martinsville, lake monroe and bedford.
content.summary: Big red glowing orb traveled across the sky slowly. no blinking lights.

content.detailedDescription:
On the night of july 4th 2011, my fianc'e and i were in our front yard watching the local neighborhood fireworks when my fianc'e noticed something odd in the sky, i looked and saw what she was referring to as i had seen this exact light years before. i knew it was a ufo, from memory and feeling, i was excited, my fianc'e could only stare in amazement as she had always wanted to see something like it. we knew instantly that it was no firework as it moved horizontally, emitted a faint hum and stayed in place after a time as though observing the neighborhood well above the treeline. 

i then told my fianc'e to run and get our camera so we could document it. in the time it took her to run and get our camera, the first light disappeared from sight once it ascended vertically. as she came back out of our house with our camera, another light identically in all ways, (movement, appearance and sound) appeared and she took 4 images of the light. it then ascended vertically and disappeared just as the first had.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Reddish orange balls of light

content.detailedDescription:
I was heading on 419, easterly direction (?), not good with that. came to the intersection of 419 & 455 when i turned my head to look at the road and to see the bend up a ways to see if anyone was coming. when a silver object caught my eye, at first i thought it was a plane, coming towards me,then it stopped,no movement- at all. it would be hard not to see it if you looked up,it was overly shiny silver, triangular shaped with the front tip pointed the direction i just came from. it seemed to be about 1000ft up, visibility was clear, no clouds anywhere. i sat there and watched,i was thinking, with amazement,  another flying saucer in less than 5 years? it felt like a minute to a minute and a half, when all of a sudden, before my eyes, it banked up and was gone. i got out of my car to see if it or a plane was anywhere near, i had the only craft within eyesight. this was 10:31-10:33 a.M. on a saturday morning. i picked up my phone and put in a call to rory roach,he is the man i sent my last sighting to, but he was not available & no message could be left.
whatever happened to the flying saucers of the 1950's, that look like their namesake? do those kind still exist or are they like us and get new crafts all the time?
content.summary: It was in a clear blue sky,no clouds,shiny triangle

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside watching fireworks down the street from my home.
it caught the corner of my eye. it started as one red light and it began to multiply. 
at one point there were 10 lights visible.

at first i thought it could be a plane. it was not!
the object or objects made no sound. one red light followed by another then a third one flickered on behind them and so on. as they passed over my head i got in the car to drive down to a golf course for a better view.
i felt very scared and excited at the same time.
i lost sight of them as they flickered out over the horizon.   

this is the third time i saw these red lights in the sky. the first time was july 3rd 2010 and july 4th 2010. 

i am an amateur astronomer and i have also been in the aerospace and defense industry for over 15 years. what i saw was not jet planes and it was not a planet or stars. 
these looked like the same lights that were filmed over arizona a few years back.
content.summary: Multiple red non blinking lights

content.detailedDescription: On july 4th 2011 at approximately 9:15pm cst i was standing out on the stairs videotaping the fireworks with my young daughter when all of the sudden i see this bright object appear out of nowhere. it was really bright and shaped like a big circle or disc maybe and appeared to be glowing. i immediately called my husband out to witness the event because i knew that this was no plane craft or any firework debris...This was a ufo! the ufo was moving southeast across the sky, had no sound at all, and not once did the ufo flash or change colors, it was like this great ball of light. in addition the ufo did not move in a straight line it was like it was descending as it was moving across but it appeared to be swaying! i was recording at the time so i managed to get film of this event although i have looked at the playback yet, it lasted about 5 min until it finally dimmed then dissapeared in the distance. im sure i cant be the only one to witness this event being that everyone looks to the skies on july 4th!!! if not a ufo, then was it a missle or something??? someone please explain!!!
content.shape: Circle,   Disc,   Fireball,   Oval,   Sphere,   Unknown
content.summary: Bright ufo flying over crowley, tx

content.detailedDescription:
Ok i was out side watching the fireworks and i looked up at a airplane flying past then there where 2 more flying objects that i thought where planes right next to each other i thought they where all going to crash and then more and more started flying slowly in a straight line and forming 

i have video from my cell phone it is not so good but you can still see it in hd on youtube!

[link moved to additional evidence setion/cms/tg]

i am also uploading the raw file in the attachment so you can get a better view
content.summary: Orange glowing lights 15-30 of them

content.detailedDescription:
I went out on my back porch to smoke( faces east) when my neighbor across the street set off an arial firework. i got up to see if he would set off somemore when i turned to the east and saw a bright orange object in the sky in a east north east direction ( toward madison). i thought that it might be a hospital helicopter since that is the path they take when going to the louisville, ky. hospitals. after a minute, i noticed that it wasn't moving very fast, so i went inside and grabbed my binoculars(10x50) to look at it. i noticedthat there was no flashing white lights, nor was there any green and red lights as required by faa. i opened the door and yelled at my wife to grab the camera and come outside. she just came outside and ask what and i said get the camera. by the time she grabbed the camera and came back outside, the object disappeared. 
i asked her what time it was (she had a cell phone) and it was 9:50pm.
i know it wasn,t fireworks for i was also watching my neighbor across the field (approx. 1/2 mile away) and his fireworks were not making it over the trees in my yard.
according to my eastimates it was approx. 35 - 45 degrees (when i first saw it to the time it disappeared) in the sky.
i could hold up a pea and it would cover it at arms length.


thanks
name deleted fg
content.summary: Bright orange light

content.detailedDescription: Second time we have seen this phenomenon in the past 12 months. we sit out back at night. from the nw we saw app. 4 bright orange glowing spheres rising. they were traveling at great spped up into the atmosphere. over the course of about 2 hours they continued to rise in great numbers. some took formations and some did not. we noticed the same things reported all over the country over the past few days.
content.summary: Bright orange spheres rising

content.detailedDescription:
6 30 11
1940
resume of phone to witness re case #29790	
background
 former policeman
lives near pit and is familiar with flying aircraft
 systems analyst at pitt
at approximately 10:10 pm on june 29 the witness was summoned outside of his house by his wife regarding a white light in the sky. the night was especially clear with no cloud cover. he lives on the top of a hill and was able to follow the object for 5 minutes. he states that the light was round, totally white [displaying no other colors], and having no projections. it passed directly overhead  moved at a constant velocity from the beginning to the end of observation.  he followed the light from northwest to southeast when winked out. he could see no silhouette. there were 2 aircraft in the sky at that time; one was in a landing pattern to the pittsburgh airport and another higher up identified by the red, white, and green lights. [������where you can see vapor trails������]. the object seemed to be above the lower aircraft but lower than the higher aircraft [33,000-35,000 ft?]. he could not give an accurate appraisal of the distance to either craft. he states the white round object appeared to between him and the higher craft because the white object blotted out the airliner. he denied any sensory, motor, or psychologic events.
he says he has seen many satellites and this one was different primarily due its size; larger.
i checked the heaven���s above web site. the international space station was listed as having very nearly the same trajectory and time of the observation.
a check of the local newspapers and tv web sites revealed nothing on lights in the sky.

One day i was outside, siting on my hammock, when all of the sudden i saw an egg falling from the sky. i didn't know if it was a prank, or if i was getting punked, but i knew that it was none of these things. then suddenly my dogie started barked extra loud, and ran towards it, it did land in the farmhouse. i tried to run after rex, and when i got there i saw him bleeding on the floor rapidly from the ears, but he wasn't doing anything, just standing there.When the egg shaped thing opened up and i went blind for.....Approximately 45 min.... my eye sight finally came back and there were 40 foot prints in the mud, and in my house, the broke the entire first level of the house. there is nothing but soot.
content.summary: Egg shaped

content.detailedDescription: As i was talking my dogs for a walk i noticed a bright light in the sky to the west about 4-6 times the size of a star. it was pulsating, and moving slower than a plane or helicopter. as i watched for about 3-4 minutes it slowly begin to fade. it was still pulsating but each time it pulsated the light got dimmer and dimmer until it was gone.
content.summary: Pulsating light slowly dissapears.

content.detailedDescription:
This evening at approx 8:01 pm, i was sitting in the tv room with my wife; i mentioned i heard a band playing. she mentioned, that���s probably the celebration for the completion of the world���s tallest sand castle. at winding trails. as i stepped out the back door to identify the tune being played (looking west), i looked up and noticed a large cloud formation in the midst of the beautiful blue sky. the sun was setting, so it was crystal clear around this one large cloud, with the exception of a few smaller dissipating clouds. the sun had been setting so the sky was blue around and behind the clouds (west).

i then noticed to my upper right (north / north west), a shinny silver cylindrical fuselage "bullet shaped craft". as the sky was a perfectly clear, this thing was traveling from the north side of my house towards the west approaching the cloud. at first i asked myself, ���is this a plane? i felt it was something different. then i noticed it had no wings or tail. it had what looked like two small fins with two white short air streaks following (less than half the size of the craft), this was coming off the fins (not a contrail). i also noticed it was silent, no sound, no engine was heard. we have much traffic from bradley airport and you can hear jets engines or prop engines readily at even higher altitudes. 

the craft seemed to be traveling in an arc toward this (cloud) destination. now as it went into the cloud, i wanted to verify this was not a plane, as well as observe it further. as the trees seemed to be blocking this view, i quickly ran through the house to the front of the house to our driveway. i was viewing the cloud and sure enough no objects came out the backend.
 
since, i could see this thing clearly, i believe it was traveling very slow - perhaps 100 to 200 mph it seemed to glide upward toward the cloud. upon looking at the cloud, to see where it might be. i then noticed it was became stationary near a small cloud. as the cloud drifted, it seemed to go with it in our direction. it was now over our home. i looked up right under this thing, it had a haze around it, and seemed semi-transparent. while looking under it - still at cloud level it had one red light (blinking) directly in the middle of the craft.

as it hovered over my home, it then it blinked once, then twice and disappeared. it was a something to watch.

after checking cloud ceiling levels from new britian weather channel, they were reported at 4900 feet. the distance to the object was walked off and calculated to a distance of 6,169 feet. the object was initially in a cloud bank directly over the park event which was located at 3,748 feet.

on a conservative calculation, using the cloud levels (weather.Com),the distance to the event over which it was stationed (once at my home) and (just 1/2 mile away-over the outdoor event), the craft size would be approximately between 100 to 150 feet long. it had what looked like a black streak down the middle of the crafts length and what looked like windows.

i hereby allow mufon to study this case, to see if similar cases have been reported. i heard channel 8 news captured a few unidentified crafts in the storm clouds last week.
content.summary: Cylindrical fuselage with strip and two small fins seen over farmington during winding trails celebration.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting on the beach at north myrtle beach, sc around 9:54pm looking south east.  i looked towards the sky to my left which is (east) and noticed a bright light in the sky.  i thought it was a plane as there are usually planes coming into the airport with their lights on.  i then looked back about 3 seconds later and focused more attention on the light, but i did not see any blinking lights so it could have not been a plane. 

i grabbed my camera and tried to take some video.  sorry the video is so shaky but it was the first time i had used a video camera at night and as you probably already know its not easy to focus and remain still without a tripod. 

the camera is a sony hdr cx160.  it has a 30x optical zoom and a 350x digital zoom.  i was using the 30 frames per sec setting on hd 1080i.  

as you can see from the video when i get the darn thing into view the orb or light is very bright.  it's actually better to view the entire video in slow motion frame by frame.  

once i finally got the light into view it appeared to accelerate away from me very fast so i zoomed in.  it appeared on the screen to come back into view (from the zoom) and then started to disappear again further away from me.  i then used the digital zoom at this time but the image got blurry as you can see from the video and then disappeared.  

not sure what it was but i did not see any blinking lights on it as a plane would have. 

any ideas?

i also have a video that's about 50 meg.  where do i send it to?

[link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]
content.summary: Bright white light orb seen over myrtle beach, sc

content.detailedDescription:
I was out walking alone, made it mid block of henry place, between garretson / cromwell. lights caught my eye. looked up observed slowly moving lights, red/orange/yellow. the light appeared to be to be attached but i could see stars between them. seemed to be headed to the ocean in a brooklyn direction

i honestly belive the lights were a one of those military predator unmanned aircraft or the stealth helicopter they took out binladin with

the light slowed and speed up together.  the lights were forward direction facing like a flashlight once the light went out of my field of view  it was as if it vanished, but i could still see the second light until it to moved away from me.

i dont know what it was reporting it cause other folks have seen them aswell

sorry no photo or video
content.summary: Shape unknown, two light spaced equal distance. as if they were attached and facing in one direction foward,  bright red/orange/yellow light
